results.name: Triangle formed using Pascal's rule except begin and end n-th row with n-1.
comment: Central terms for n>0: T(2*n,n)=A024483(n+1), T(n,[n/2])=A116385(n-1); for n>1: T(n,1) = T(n,n-1) = A000217(n-2). [_Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 13 2011]
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n=0..100 of triangle, flattened
Index entries for triangles and arrays related to Pascal's triangle
mathematica: Clear[t]; t[n_, k_] := t[n, k] = t[n-1, k] + t[n-1, k-1]; t[n_, 0] := n-1; t[n_, n_] := n-1; Table[t[n, k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 11 2013 *)
program: (MAGMA) /* As triangle */ [[Binomial(n+2,k+1) - 3*Binomial(n,k): k in [0..n]]: n in [0.. 10]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jan 11 2019
